options.title: -f
options.description: The -f option is used when a user name is specified to indicate that proper authentication has already been done and that no password need be requested. This option may only be used by the superuser.

options.title: -h hostname
options.description: Specifies the host from which the connection was received. This option may only be used by the superuser.

options.title: -L local-addr
options.description: The -L option specifies the local address of a socket. This information is passed on to any classify script (see login.conf(5)).

options.title: -p
options.description: By default, login discards any previous environment. The -p option disables this behavior.

options.title: -R remote-addr
options.description: The -R option specifies the remote address of a socket. This information is passed on to any classify script (see login.conf(5)).

options.title: -u username
options.description: Specifies the remote user that initiated the connection. This option may only be used by the superuser.
